definition: to look for a job/to seek employment

sentences.english: Upon completing my graduate study, I will return to China and seek a job in a business firm.
sentences.chinese: 研究生學業完成後，我將返回中國，在企業謀職。

sentences.english: A few took jobs in government.
sentences.chinese: 少部分的人在政府中謀職。

sentences.english: A lack of qualifications can be a major obstacle to finding a job.
sentences.chinese: 學歷不足可能成爲謀職的主要障礙。

sentences.english: I'd like to take a job overseas, but there are too many things tying me down here.
sentences.chinese: 我想到國外謀職，但這兒有許多事情使我分不開身。

sentences.english: To everyone's surprise, I decided to seek employment in the financial sector.
sentences.chinese: 讓大家感到喫驚的是，我決定在金融界謀職。

sentences.english: Why did you choose to come here for a job？
sentences.chinese: 你爲何選定到此地來謀職？

sentences.english: International students are not allowed to take jobs.
sentences.chinese: 留學生在校期間不得私自謀職。

definition: lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1

definition: toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
abbr. of 資訊工程|资讯工程[zi1 xun4 gong1 cheng2]
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1
